subject: Fashion
title: The Thin Ideal in Fashion History
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Thin Ideal in Fashion History.

hook.text: In the 1600s, the ideal body was plump and curvy. By the 1960s, Twiggy's size-zero frame ruled.

buildup.text: Fashion's ideal body has swung wildlyâ€”corsets, bustles, flappers, heroin chic, and everything between.

discovery.text: The thin ideal intensified with mass media. Models shrank from size 8 in the 1970s to size 0 by 2000.

twist.text: The ideal was never about health. Thinness became aspirational precisely when food became abundant.

climax.text: Every era's 'perfect body' is impossible for most. That's the pointâ€”it fuels endless consumption.

punchline.text: The ideal body keeps changing. That's by design.

quiz.question: Why did thinness become the dominant beauty ideal in fashion?
options: Scientific research proved thin bodies are objectively healthier
Thinness became aspirational when food abundance made it a marker of discipline and scarcity
Fashion designers could only create patterns for thin body types
